donor_name: DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS AND INTERNATIONAL TRADE (DFAIT) GOVERMENT OF CANADA
outputs.output_descr:
The Northern Border Project (NBP) on the border between Jordan and Syria is 104 kilometres of continuous minefields with an estimated 136,000 mines, which varies in width from 30 metres to almost 1 kilometre with changing topography, ground conditions, rock mineral content, and vegetation throughout. 

It is also a mixed minefield with antipersonnel mines (AP) and anti-tank (AT) mines. Each AT-mine is guarded by 3 APs. In addition, reinforcement minefields, also with bounding fragmentation mines, have been laid randomly and scattered along the whole NBP without proper recording, complicating the clearance/verification implementation significantly.

The National Committee for Demining and Rehabilitation (NCDR) tasked Norwegian People's Aid (NPA) to undertake the project after they successfully completed the Southern Border/Wadi Araba project.  NCDR is responsible to provide independent quality management and continuously conduct QA/QC of all NPA operations.
